queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-metrics}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubeauth-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-server}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false
metadata.name={{kubeauth-controller}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-controller}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation should be set and should be set to false

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{kubeauth-metrics}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{kubeauth-controller}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-controller}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
metadata.name={{kubeauth-server}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{kubeauth-server}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
Memory limits should be defined for each container. This prevents potential resource exhaustion by ensuring that containers consume not more than the designated amount of memory
Memory requests should be defined for each container. This allows the kubelet to reserve the requested amount of system resources and prevents over-provisioning on individual nodes
Containers should drop 'ALL' or at least 'NET_RAW' capabilities
Check if Readiness Probe is not configured.

queries.query_name: Role Binding To Default Service Account
queries.description: No role nor cluster role should bind to a default service account
Containers should be configured with a secure Seccomp profile to restrict potentially dangerous syscalls

queries.query_name: Service Account Token Automount Not Disabled
queries.description: Service Account Tokens are automatically mounted even if not necessary

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-server}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{kubeauth-controller}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false
metadata.name={{kubeauth-metrics}}.spec.template.spec.automountServiceAccountToken should be defined and set to false

queries.description: Service has an external load balancer, which may cause accessibility from other networks and the Internet
CPU limits should be set because if the system has CPU time free, a container is guaranteed to be allocated as much CPU as it requests
CPU requests should be set to ensure the sum of the resource requests of the scheduled Containers is less than the capacity of the node
Deployments should be assigned with a PodDisruptionBudget to ensure high availability

files.expected_value: metadata.name=kubeauth-monitoring is targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget
files.actual_value: metadata.name=kubeauth-monitoring is not targeted by a PodDisruptionBudget

queries.description: Containers should be configured with an AppArmor profile to enforce fine-grained access control over low-level system resources

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-monitoring}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-monitoring}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-metrics}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-monitoring}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-metrics}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-monitoring}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-controller}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-controller}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-controller}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-controller}}

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-server}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations should specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-server}}
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-server}}.spec.template.metadata.annotations does not specify an AppArmor profile for container {{kubeauth-server}}

queries.description: Sees if Kubernetes Drop Capabilities exists to ensure containers security context
Each namespace should have a LimitRange policy associated to ensure that resource allocations of Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims do not exceed the defined boundaries

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{kubeauth-controller}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{kubeauth-metrics}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated
metadata.name={{kubeauth-server}} does not have a 'LimitRange' policy associated

queries.description: Each namespace should have a ResourceQuota policy associated to limit the total amount of resources Pods, Containers and PersistentVolumeClaims can consume

metadata.name={{kubeauth-metrics}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{kubeauth-monitoring}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
metadata.name={{kubeauth-server}} does not have a 'ResourceQuota' policy associated
